Reviews.Title: “Mixed review....”
Reviews.Author: fpgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our flight due to the threat of snow in the morning, using Marriott Rewards points. When we made our reservation we were told to ask about an upgrade when we checked in. We did that and were upgraded to the 'Suite Level'. Apparently I don't know what 'Suite Level' means since the room we were in was one of the smallest I've ever seen. Also, the 'Suite Level' lounge isn't open on the weekends so whatever is offered in there remains to be seen. We were in a room that faced the pool and as other reviewers have stated, it can be loud at times. We looked at the menu for the restaurant - prices were off-putting so we opted for dinner in the bar. That probably was the best thing about this Marriott - the food was good and reasonably priced. There was some kind of convention being held at this location so the bar was a little louder than one would expect at 6 pm on a Saturday night. There was also a mix-up on the parking charge...we were told when we made the reservation that parking was complimentary for the night you stayed at the hotel. When we checked in, the front desk quoted a parking charge and couldn't be convinced that we were told otherwise. In the morning when we checked out, that front desk clerk asked if everything went alright - I related the parking charge incident and asked it that could be 'comped' - she agreed to do so. We had planned on parking at another lot for the duration of our trip due to the Marriott's high rate to park there - when we asked for our car, the valet asked why we weren't parking there - explanation given - then we were given a MUCH lower daily rate which we took advantage of. The airport shuttle was efficient. Because we are loyal Marriott customers, we'd probably stay here again but request a tower room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: United858
Reviews.Content: While the pool is great for families, the accompanying noise can be quite annoying if you are trying to sleep. The shuttle was great and timely! The room was quite average. The location however close to the airport is hard to beat. Worked just fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Ok at normal rates but not at higher than normal rates”
Reviews.Author: section
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice due to flight cancellations and it was fine. Then I stayed for one week when every single hotel downtown was booked except the Four Seasons and paid the highest rates I've ever seen listed at this location. A big plus was dining at the bar and room service was very good. The staff was also helpful for getting a package sent and other requests. Overall, food and service compensated for old rooms and noise. At normal rates this is average, but at near full rates, you can't help but feel let down.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected treat”
Reviews.Author: sixlegsup
Reviews.Content: This is an 'airport' hotel, located a stone's throw from the terminal. I was expecting something very average but was pleasantly surprised by the facilities, service and food. We had a room facing the airport but were never disturbed by the planes. Pros: Nice pool in the atrium. Lots of families used it. Cozy yet spacious lobby and bar with a central fire place Very good gym with free weights to 50lbs and lots of cardio machines Better than average restaurant Clean room and very comfortable bed Cons: The bathroom was showing it's age a little Also, I personally like a ceiling exhaust fan in a bathroom which these didn't have Atrium rooms could get a little noisy The parking in the hotel lot can get full quickly The cons are really quibbles. For this style of hotel, it exceeded my expectations. The location is also convenient to gas stations and some decent restaurants, especially Mango if you like Thai food.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a quiet night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: rstorr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a flight cancellation at SeaTac. Location is good for the airport, close by and they run a regular free shuttle. After spending most of the day at the airport I was very hungry so tried the lobby bar. Had to wait about 10mins for a waiter, despite the bar being quite empty, only about 3 other tables. They claim the food is freshly cooked but my chicken came out in about 5mins so am sure it was pre prepared, otherwise I'm sure I'd be poisoned if it was actually cooked that quickly. Rooms were terrible if you want to get any sleep. The walls were paper thin and I could hear the entire conversation from the next room when they were just speaking at a normal level. They also have a terrible alarm clock which has a bright light on the top (the snooze button) which stays illuminated all night and lights up the room. I had to put mine on the floor and cover with something so could have some darkness. Luckily I hadn't paid for this, as paid by the airline, but if I had I would have been asking for my money back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't gripe for $50 on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: alanglazen
Reviews.Content: This is a "cut above" airport hotel. Nicer rooms, comfortable bed, soft linens and very professional and friendly front desk. But the very best thing is that you walk across the street to the train station, and can get downtown in expensively and quickly. I've booked this for $50 numerous times by bidding on Priceline, so you can save a bundle too. Just bid for a 3+ star Sea hotel for $50, and you'll either end up here or the slightly lessor Doubletree across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mimiteach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business conference, but the staff and the hotel made it feel like a mini vacation. Great atmosphere, beautiful decor. The food was pretty good for a Marriott and the breakfast buffet is excellent. the staff was helpful and attentive and they have the best shuttle drivers. My only complaint is that we didn't have toilet paper in the bathroom. I called guest services and left for the day. When I returned at midnight I still didn't have toilet paper and had to use my colleagues' bathroom. What I did have was a big bag full of toiletries. They misunderstood. Who can take a huge bag of shampoo and conditioner and lotion on a plane??I called again and this time was given two rolls of toilet paper. It was midnight. I was leaving in the morning. They overcompensated for their mistake. My concern was the fact that housekeeping had cleaned the room and supposedly cleaned the bathroom. They didn't put toilet paper in the bathroom for two days. How'd they miss that? Left a little sore spot for me and I didn't leave them a tip. I bet they didn't miss that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happymcmartin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Seattle Airport Marriott many times over the years. However, this most recent stay was our first time in quite a bit. We decided to return because the indoor tropical is fantastic and still is!! Rooms are very nice (a little small but great beds and workable), staff was very helpful and we loved the new lobby! Breakfast was fantastic and parking was easy. Close to the airport and easy access to get downtown. We were very impressed yet again, and we plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Ok property for early flights”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: This is an ok property nothing outstanding. Older and showing it's age. Bathroom is small. Beds are comfortable but pillows could be better (tried both feather and foam and both were uncomfortable). Good new and modern gym- had a pool overlooking pool and courtyard..... personally would prefer to look outside. Was a bit noisy from people using pool. All in all a good place to rest but nothing memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A good business class Marriott”
Reviews.Author: 4959keeton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night in order to catch a morning flight out of SEA. I found a AAA special rate so it was a good value. As a Marriott Rewards elite member I was given a room on the Concierge floor. The room was standard (good) Marriott in good shape and comfortable. The TV had a good selection of channels and quite a few were in hi-def. The wired internet speed was pretty good. Since I was car-less I ate in the restaurant and it was pretty good. The hotel has a shuttle that runs every 15 minutes to the airport. It is about 2-3 blocks to get to the light rail station that can take you to downtown Seattle. One strange detail is that the pool is in an atrium in the middle of the hotel and as a result the atrium stays very humid. This hotel is a good choice if you need to be near the airport and can get it for a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: PP81Augusta
Reviews.Content: Located about 5 min from Sea-Tac via free shuttle, the hotel has a very nice tropical indoor pool in a large atrium. The room is nice and typical for standard Marriotr room. Room service was decent. It was delivered a bit later than the promised 30 min and I was automatically called by guest service to have the meal for free ( which I declined since I was not in a rush but it was a very nice gesture by the staff). The room is quiet and the bed is confortable. Overall, it is one of the nicest airport hotels that I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,poor value”
Reviews.Author: 63tracks
Reviews.Content: Had better experience on prior stays. Rooms in need of updating. Expected a nicer room for the price($199) at almost double the cost of the majority of airport hotels in the area. Was given a ground floor room adjacent to the parking lot even though there were numerous other options available. Noise from the parking lot was an issue throughout the night. Service has always been very good. The pool is very nice, especially for families. Overall was disappointed for the money spent and will try different hotels in the area on next visit. The staff was attentive to issues but in this price range I expect it to be right the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: abarbour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before flying to Kauai - I have no complaints! We were able to long- stay park right on the Marriot property and it actually ended up being cheaper than the park n'fly lot we were going to use. When we returned home, we were promptly met by the shuttle and I think we maybe waited two minutes for them to pull our car around. We'll be staying here again the next time we fly out of Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, convenient”
Reviews.Author: FBernal99
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd try this instead of my normal hotel in Federal Way so that I wouldn't have to drive in inclement weather late at night. Seemed nice enough, sort of like an Embassy Suites with a covered atrium and large pool. Nicely appointed rooms. That's all I know since I was only there for about 8 hours!

Reviews.Title: “OLD BUT BEAUTIFULLY RENOVATED - COMFORT PLUS”
Reviews.Author: madgicsh
Reviews.Content: Our first view was not encouraging, but we came to realise very quickly that they had chosen to spend their renovation dollar inside, rather than on externals. That's fine by us, it was superb! The rainforest around the pool and the huge timber-beamed canopy over, gave us our first real taste of Pacific North West style; the food was great at both dinner and breakfast, and the room was luxury plus. When our rental car failed to arrive, they were far more helpful than Hertz in resolving the problem! I would always stay here again after a cross-Pacific flight.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight before early flight”
Reviews.Author: newharp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before an early flight from SEATAC the next morning. Check-in was fine and they have a convenient computer right by the desk where you can print your boarding pass. We were pedestrian passengers on the ferry from Bainbridge Island to Seattle, and there were plenty of cabs to meet the ferry and the ride to the hotel isn't very long. It was just a quick overnight stay, but the property was as you'd expect a Marriott to be: clean, smartly decorated, professional staff, everything functional. The indoor pool was pretty although we didn't use it. The complimentary shuttle to the airport is timely and convenient. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kortkass
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and normal size. The indoor pool area looked great. The staff are friendly. It is quiet, especially for being by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice”
Reviews.Author: BabsX8
Reviews.Content: Have gone to this hotel many, many times, but this time the hot tub smelled like crap, and I mean litterally crap. The price was shockingly high for a king room. used to pay 129.00 for a fri to sat stay and now it was close to 200.00. Definetly won't be going back unless every hotel in Seattle is full, and I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here one night and had to switch hotels”
Reviews.Author: MaMa6363
Reviews.Content: I don't know if its because i have high expectations when it comes to the Marriott but i was didn't like my room at this place. the staff is great don't get me wrong but when it came to the room well... i didn't feel comfortable. i hate it when my bathroom is dirty at home but can you imagine a hotel bathroom where hundreds of people have used it. their showers are tiled and they don't keep this tile clean. also when i went to close my curtains i got a gust of dust. another thing i didnt like was the shuttle is not 24 hours. i needed to be at the airport at 3am and they didn't have a shuttle running. so now is the day after my stay at the Marriott and Im now at the comfort suites in tukwila. 24 hour shuttle, very clean and large room, great staff and they gave us pizza and salad as an afternoon snack and breakfast in the morning for free. i would not recommend the Marriott but i would the comfort suites

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but problems (& lies) with reservations”
Reviews.Author: so3008
Reviews.Content: Pros: This hotel is very clean, nicely decorated, relatively quiet and the food in the restaurant is delicious. It's also minutes from the airport, yet does not have that "airport hotel" feel. Staff is friendly. Cons: Pricey compared to nearby airport hotels (we paid $200/night). Rooms are small. Indoor pool is nice, but loaded with chlorine (atrium smells like a hot tub). Our daughters' eyes were burning after their swim. Concierge level cocktail hour is just a cash bar on the 8th floor. Food and drinks are not included in the upgrade. Now for the warnings: Do not trust anything the Marriott reservation agent tells you. I made our reservation by calling the hotel directly and being transferred to Marriott's main reservation center. I normally book online, but wanted to know why the rate was so much higher than the last time we stayed at this property. I was told it was because of the holidays (our stay was Jan. 3) and because the hotel was almost completely booked. I was told there were only a few rooms left and I should book immediately. When I told her I am a Marriott Rewards member, the agent very nicely offered to upgrade us to concierge level and she said she'd put us in a corner room since they're larger. Great! But when we arrived, none of that happened. The desk clerk didn't even have any notes in our reservation about that. We asked if the hotel was booked and he said "no" and that it was practically empty!! The reservation agent lied. We asked if he would honor our promise of concierge level and he said he would. We got to our room on the 7th floor, only to find the concierge level is on the 8th floor! The desk clerk lied to our faces. We were not in a corner room and despite the hotel's near emptiness, we were put in a room next to a family with an infant that cried much of the night. We don't chalk this one up to a horrible experience. They were minor problems, but you should be warned that promises made during booking are not taken seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: JMPInstructor
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday night on the first floor facing the atrium. Wonderful room, clean, high quality bed and linen. This hotel is the best of the Marriott brands that I have visited. The atmosphere and design is great, they've put a lot of thought into this and thankfully haven't done what corporate did to the Courtyard brand and ruin the local flare in favor of some screwed up sense of what the traveller wants. The atrium is beautiful, the spa was nice, but a little too hot. Breakfast at the Aqua Terra was good. The waterfalls and foliage add to a nice brunch. This is a great spot for a couple in the winter looking for a little bit of romance.

Reviews.Title: “Old bed -- bad night sleep”
Reviews.Author: Radarman123
Reviews.Content: Yes I know it an airport hotel. But it is a Marriott. Should be a Motel 8. Rooms are small. They gave me a corner room on the exec floor. HORRIBLE BED. Could not find a comfortable spot (like the mattress had holes in it). Restaurant was down (yes out of service for remodeling). So you are forced to use the Terrace restaurant by the pool. Exec lounge -- tiny. 3 floors of exec rooms and such a small lounge. OK if the lounge was small. But good food -- NOT. The evening snacks were some tired spring rolls and some salad sticks. YECH...

Reviews.Title: “NICE but $$$$”
Reviews.Author: KARAAK
Reviews.Content: I must say this is a nice hotel. WE stay here 11/30/2011 just passing through. IT was every $$$$$. But you get what you pay for. Our flight got cancel and we needed something close. The room was small but very cozy. I ask for a crib and it was already there and waiting for our baby. I wish it was a little cheaper but I felt safe and welcomed... GREAT STAFF, CLEAN ROOMS.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than a normal airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan_from_Hampshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here a few times in the past and did so again this summer, for one night after a long day's flying from London at the start of a long road trip. What we like - and still liked this year after several years' break - is that although it's a big chain hotel, at an airport, it has a much smaller feel to it than most such hotels. When you enter the Reception area, the style is reminiscent of some of those lodge hotels you find in national parks - all stone and wooden beams - and on a more modest scale than many large hotels. The staff seem helpful and friendly, and the rooms comfortable and well-equipped as you would expect. The rooms are built around a large closed atrium in which there's a pool. We've never tried the pool but we like the fact that it's there. It does mean that about half the rooms face inwards onto this area; we've always had rooms facing outwards, which I think may be better. The restaurant also is not bad for a chain hotel - we've eaten there several times in the past so did so again this time, and again were very happy with it. The restaurant doesn't seem very large but there was no problem getting a table, either for the evening or next morning for breakfast. Breakfast is good - but you have to make a choice between the extensive buffet (including freshly made omelets etc) or a la carte. Both were fine but you can't mix and match the two options, which made the choice harder as some things were only available on one and not the other, and vice versa. You have to pay to park at the hotel - I can't remember how much but it all adds the cost. As there's a Hertz rental office in the hotel, I suppose a good option might be to take the hotel shuttle from the airport, then pick up one's rental car from there the next morning - saving on a day's rental, and the cost of parking. It's just a thought. So - overall - this hotel is perfect for a night after arriving from afar. I'm sure we'll stay here again, the time our travels take us through Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: planeengineer
Reviews.Content: Had another great stay at the Seattle Sea-Tac Airport Marriott. However, first time in a while (and probably the last time) I've had dinner in the on-site restaurant. They appeared to be understaffed with servers thus very slow service. Food was mediocre at best and expensive. Also, unless you have a Smart Car, you'll find the self-parking parking stalls to be extremely tight. I could barely get my mid-sized rental car into a spot and still allow for me and my passenger to get in and out of the car.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than an average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnfi
Reviews.Content: Often times saying “airport hotel” has a connotation to a certain bare minimum room close to the airport but this hotel is more than that. Overall I would say it’s an average Marriott, well-kept considering it seems like the typical 80’s style layout etc. The northwest feel is nice with public areas with post and beams is nice and more than just a boxy hotel. The pool area would be great for families but not so much for adults traveling alone unless later in the evening but since it’s in the middle of the hotel everyone has to walk by and many rooms overlook the interior courtyard. The rooms are nice, textbook Marriott with furnishings and comfy bed however the bathrooms are tiny and barely room to move around in. Location for the airport is great with shuttles or a short 3 min drive. Hotel parking is fair based on cost and location and valet is a little more and prob worth it for convenience. All in all an average Marriott but I would say a great option for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: kcschueler
Reviews.Content: Good location to the Sea-Tac Airport with a free shuttle. Try to book a room on the side opposite of the airport for a better night's sleep. The fitness room is a little small for the number of people that were using the room. The hotel is always clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience..”
Reviews.Author: erdrlady
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its location to the airport and the indoor pool..no one told us at check in that there was a private party at the pool..when we saw signs stating it was closed, we tried to call the front desk for almost 20 min before we got someone to answer and they weren't real apologetic about the fact we couldn't use the pool..we also got charged twice for our room service but they did get that resolved..we also had neighbors who were loud all night but we never could get anyone to answer at the front desk..

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel close to airport and mall”
Reviews.Author: Niuhiti
Reviews.Content: If you do not have a car , stlll want to do some shopping but are flying tomorrow, this is the convenient hotel for you. We took this hotel after our cruise, paid only 52 usd for the cab on saturday. No need to take the shuttle. We even manage to leave one heavy bagage before the cruise. The hotel accepted it and it was practical. Front staff very helpful. As we were busy shopping , we did not use the hotel facilities so we are unable to comment. The room was large and nice, nice bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option for Sea Tac Area”
Reviews.Author: islandjule
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night b/c arrived late at Sea Tac Airport. Shuttle very convenient (courtesy phone located at ground transport at airport if you don't see van). Hotel has Pacific Northwest theme. Staff (from shuttle driver to front desk) very friendly. Used Marriott reward points for 1 King room. Very small. If you look on floorplan on back of door, there are just a few of these smaller rooms on each floor - book 2 queens for more room or ask for larger King room. Also, we had interior courtyard view (overlooking indoor pool - no natural light). Fine for one night, but would have been bummed if more than that. Room was clean and looked newly refurbished. Had breakfast at on-site restaurant next day. Pricey, but lots of choices, inc breakfast buffet. Also coffee bar w/pastries, muffins open in am. Took shuttle back to airport in morning to rent car for week-end - so we avoided paying for parking at the hotel which is expensive. As we drove back to airport next day, noticed that Marriott Sea Tac seems like one of nicest options on airport strip of typical chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - unsafe parking lot”
Reviews.Author: SemiconductorGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott last night, self-parking our car for $19.00 in the gated lot. Our car was broken into during the night and our in-dash GPS/receiver was stolen. We were parked just a few feet away from the southeast entrance, in a well-lit area, directly under a lamp. Evidently this is a high theft area near the Sea-Tac Airport; however, this parking lot has insufficient surveillance. The other disappointment was that we didn't get a good night's rest. When booking we requested a high floor, Concierge level. What we got was ground floor facing the pool. We asked twice to have a quiet room and were told "all of our deluxe rooms face the pool."

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay and successful event!”
Reviews.Author: hatlad
Reviews.Content: Back again as host of an evening event put on in this hotel. Though the conference area was under construction all round our meeting room, the staff worked around it very effectively and all came off successfully. Not even sure our attendees were aware of the construction the way it was decorated around in the one hallway just outside. Emily and other banquet staff were terrific! Attentive to every issue of a successful event. Bravo to them. The guest room was wonderful! What is it about Marriott beds? Was clean, very quiet and exquisitely comfortable. Will probably do it again right here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise base for 12 hours - handy for airport not close to town.”
Reviews.Author: Chippyqueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before a transfer to Anchorage for a cruise, so was booked by the travel agent. We waited a while for the courtesy bus at the airport as its clearly a popular hotel so it delayed us by an hour getting into the middle of Seattle to see the Space Needle before it closed for the night ----but we made it eventually. Staff were very helpful, the barman a bit over familiar and the food wasnt great (cold and a bit limp) but it was a modern property with huge bedroom over looking a very tropical indoor pool which we sadly didnt get time to use. The airport terminal & light railway stop is at the bottom of the road so not in the middle of nowhere. I liked it - Chippyqueen says yes!

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool!”
Reviews.Author: DubPirate
Reviews.Content: The atrium pool is the highlight of this hotel. I've stayed twice and have enjoyed the tropical ambiance of the pool area. I love how close the hotel is to SeaTac airport. If you have to stay near SeaTac and want a great relaxing night, stay at the Mariott. Be aware the Mariott charges 20 dollars a night for parking. I give them a 3 for value because of the parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “The most incredible crab bisque, surrounded by a perfect room and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: verymary
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my former life, many years ago. I'm sure the hotel was terrific yet I always remembered the fabulous crab bisque I ordered from the room service menu. It was simply delectable and none I've tasted since can compare. But never one to mix my old life with my new one, I hadn't returned to this Marriott, and for these many years the memory of that crab bisque tortured me during our frequent overnight stops at SeaTac (especially with the bright red MARRIOTT sign atop the hotel beckoning from it's perch on the hill across from the airport.) Finally, I clued in my new life to this old life experience and after all this time we booked a stay here so that I could reunite with my old friend, Best Crab Bisque Ever. Woohoo! The reunion was all I had hoped it would be and more. Plus, we discovered a perfectly lovely hotel! Our beautiful room was exceptionally comfortable - and the indulgent bath amenities were the most fragrant and luxurious I've experienced in a product provided by a hotel. (Even the shuttle driver was well aware of the popularity of the product line and supplied me with ordering info as he delivered us to the light rail stop for a zip into Seattle.) The lobby decor here feels slightly rustic, with post and beam construction, but with an elegant, modern edge. The rooms are modern and good sized with large windows and lavish bedding. There is a nice pool in an atrium and the soaring ceilings and rock fireplace are reminiscent of a contemporary mountain lodge. Due in part to my happy reconnection to BCBE, the experience here was awesome and my new life and I look forward to our next stop at SeaTac and this delicious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott; good shuttle service to airport.”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandJP
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, king bed room with typical Marriott decor & amenities. (love the orange ginger aroma therapy toiletries!). Room was surprisingly quiet even though we were on main floor just around the corner from the lobby, elevator, and bar. Friendly service at front desk. Quick shuttle service to / from airport.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: John36758
Reviews.Content: Although the room was not large, it was clean and fully equipped as you would expect Marriott to be. The hotel was very close to SeaTac.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luceric
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night on the west coast at this Marriott before a morning flight. Really nice hotel & we will stay here again. Rooms were typical Marriott. It has a very large central area with a pool as well a comfortable stuffed chairs. A few things to note: They don't allow roll aways in the rooms with 2 beds. We didn't notice any restaurants within walking distance although you can walk downhill to the light rail & take a train to downtown- its not a long distance but you do need to walk uphill on the way back . The restaurant food was good but pricey for dinner. The airport is very close but we heard no airplane noise. We used the business center to print our boarding passes. Shuttle to the airport was on time and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: metrochica
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Seattle Seatac after reading all of the outstanding reviews on TripAdvisor and now I can add my own gushing review. This is a gem of an airport hotel. Beautiful lobby, atrium and pool. Clean, updated rooms. Tasty food from the restaurant. It's also just a short downhill walk to the light rail that easily takes you to downtown Seattle in 20 minutes. The staff were super helpful and friendly. I had an atrium facing room which was lovely and since I was facing inside I did not hear any planes. I did hear kids in the pool some nights, but not too late. Never loud enough to keep me from sleeping. I ate at the restaurant a few times and if you have the opportunity try their chowder. It is delicious. I also used the light rail multiple times to head into the city and it was easy, clean and fast. Definitely a fun commute. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel was a perfect oasis conveniently next to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near airport!”
Reviews.Author: andrizzle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently updated, vert clean, updated tv, bathroom was very clean and well-lit. For all you germaphobes out there, you will like this hotel. Service was very good, the front desk was approachable and willing to help. We stayed here with points so I'm not sure about the value of it, but our experience was very enjoyable. If we needed to stay near the airport again, we would pick this hotel. It's about 20 minutes from downtown. Ambience is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “All you can ask for in a Airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ramzzz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this place twice , the latest being September 2010. The hotel is a very nice place to live and very close to the Airport which makes it very convenient for the regular travelers. It have a very nice and warm feel to it, the staff was courteous and very happy help. Great rooms , good bed, Great Gym, Nice swimming pool. The food was good , specially the lobster sandwich. It was a wow. Free internet in the reception area. Well what can I say , it was great overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place & close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: 4TNTravelers
Reviews.Content: We flew into Seattle and caught the shuttle to the hotel. It was a nice place to stay overnight. We didn't have time to enjoy the indoor pool, but it looked very nice! Had breakfast at the hotel and it was good. If we are in the area, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but a little long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: ctsv157
Reviews.Content: Nice enough but in need of an upgrade which is in the works . Once its done , Id be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best airport hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Mauigal2010
Reviews.Content: We had planned to return to Seattle for one last day before heading home and elected to stay at Marriott's Sea-Tac Hotel using points. It was a comfortable place to stay - we were upgraded to the concierge floor so we had plenty of food to eat for our two night stay, and it was quiet enough to rest and for my husband to do some work. The pool area looked very inviting but we had no suits with us and we appreciated the on-time free airport shuttle. We would definitely return here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, didn't even know it was near an airport!”
Reviews.Author: jbags39
Reviews.Content: My family spend our last night of vacation at the Marriott since we had an early morning flight out. It was a great choice! Everyone there was helpful, friendly, and worked with us while trying to return a rental car near deadline time. Picked us up promptly and helped with all our baggage including car seats and strollers! We even ate dinner that the hotel restaurant and had wonderful fish and chips!! We never experienced any noise from the airport and had a very restful night. We would definitely stay here again when traveling to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Bad Music”
Reviews.Author: duke4bb
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the SeaTac Marriott for several decades. The staff is the best as are the rooms,service and cleanliness. The 'music' environement however in the lobby, resteraunt and entrance is not becoming to this professioanal facility. One would assume they were in a disco bar. We and others [customers] have commented previously with no response from management. This hotel, especially for the prices, can 'do better' since it deserves better. I would have a difficult time recommending the SeaTac Marriott until the business environment improves and that is too bad since the staff is great. Tom Evans

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: gmccomy
Reviews.Content: I went to Seattle for the first time for business and stayed at this hotel that was directly across from the airport. I was pleasantly surprised that I never once heard any noise from the airport. There customer service was first class. The hotel was extremely clean, updated, bright and airy. There accomodations were perfect. They had a great workout room, a wonderful full free service breakfast each morning, the restaurant food was very tasteful and the openness to the lobby with gift shop, bar/food and pool was very inviting.Best of all the bedding was the most comfortable bed/pillows that I have every had at a hotel. I recommend this hotel to anyone. I will have to say that I was surprised that you had to pay to park their. I am from St Louis and nowhere do we have to pay to park at a hotel. My business partner, however, did say that I should get use to paying to park b/c it is very common.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Longtonian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way back from a cruise. Considering it is an airport hotel it is outstanding, with a great indoor swimming pool, extremely comfortable beds, nice bar and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel but.....Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Aussiejack1
Reviews.Content: We recently had a weekend stay at this hotel. I would say it is a fairly average to good airport hotel. Our room was on level 1 and faced the indoor atrium pool. If you value your sleep and in particular a weekend sleep in you might want to ask not to be on this level. It was particularly noisy on the Sunday morning starting at 7.30am. Way too early for me! On the other hand on the Saturday night my girls loved the chance at being able to go for a swim indoors! So, I suppose I'll put up with the noise. The restaurant was mediocre at best. It is very dark, The menu seems limited. The kids meals are good value both at breakfast and dinner as well as room service. In the restaurant the wait staff seem flusted and busy and don't seem to accommodate your requests. After waiting about 10 min for cream for our coffee one morning we used some of the kids milk from their cereal, and had some "lovely" cold coffee. The rooms are clean and adequate but on the small size. There is no fridge in the room, but you can request one. The beds were comfortable. Overall an average airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, we would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: barbarapitts
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful. We were on our way to Alaska, and had to overnight in Seattle. The shuttle picked us up right on time, and it was a very short ride from the airport The rooms were great and so was the bar. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to return again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: NikitaH
Reviews.Content: Great airport hotel. The beds were firm, ample pillows, and an ample breakfast. A call to the hotel sent the shuttle service to pick us up quickly. They volunteered to take us to a nearby restaurant but we selected to walk. Great food at a nearby Dinner. In the morning the hotel shuttle took us back to the airport. An airport shuttle took us to downtown Seattle to pick up our Hertz rental car. We arranged to return the car to Portland. Thus, all the extra fees of renting a car from the airport were avoided. Very friendly staff at the Marriott that made everything convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: AAL08
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because we arrived at SeaTac at 10 pm and didn't want to drive very far at that time of night. The primary reason most people go to a hotel is to sleep, and that was difficult to do at this hotel. Our room faced the atrium, a covered swimming pool area, where sound echoes. There were people out at the pool until at least 2:00 a.m. -- I finally used ear plugs so I could get some sleep. Unfortunately, the early birds were out at the pool at 6:00 a.m., so it was a very short night for me! Very serious design flaw in this hotel! The parking area is also annoying. It was difficult to find my way in to the hotel registration area at night because the signage was inadequate. Then, a key is needed to exit the lot; I had left my key in the room for recycling, so I had to go back and wait for a housekeeping manager to let me in the room so I could get away from this place. Next time I arrive on the 10 p.m. flight I will drive at that time of night to find a place to actually get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A River Runs Through It!”
Reviews.Author: kcima
Reviews.Content: Don't forget your bathing suit! Each of the rooms located on the 1st floor open to a beautiful, fully landscaped atrium with an inviting pool, hot tub, and a stream running through it. Great for unwinding at the end of a long day. Airport hotels are typically scary places but Marriott has completely renovated this little gem. Staff is great and rooms are clean. Free shuttle leaves from the hotel to the airport every 15 minutes from 4:15 am to 12 am. I had a quick meal that was scrumptious. I am a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: “Unwind and de-stress in superb style and comfort”
Reviews.Author: UKBusinesslady292
Reviews.Content: After a couple of stressful flights from Alaska, the stress simply melted away from the time the airport shuttle bus picked me up to the time they said goodbye and wished me well. This Marriott is the benchmark by which ALL hotels should be measured. I am a Customer Service training specialist and even I was blown away by their utterly genuine and sincere excellent customer service. When I was told by check-in that it was a pleasure to welcome me to the hotel I actually felt very special. I could not fault them in the slightest. EVERY staff member I came across was charming, polite and superbly attentive. The beds were heavenly, so soft. Such a change from the usual cost-saving lumps of concrete often tolerated these days. My room overlooked the atrium which was absolutely delightful. A kind of indoors/outdoors area with pool well screened by foliage plus several clusters of spacious conservatory style furniture which just begged me to take advantage of. How relaxing it was to sit in comfort reading a book and unwinding. Even though the lobby area was lively with early evening guests enjoying a pre-dinner cocktail, the sense of intrusion normally felt in such hotels was noticeably absent in that the design of each area ensured privacy and intimacy. Superb customer service continued into the restaurant. Again I was blown away by their attentiveness, finely tuned to ensure it is not overdone. Not only would I highly recommend this hotel, I would even go so far as to orchestrate my schedule to necessitate another stay in the very near future. The staff should be congratulated on their service. They obviously work very hard yet are like the proverbial swan - calm and serene on the surface, whilst working harder than ever behind the scenes. A superb example of exemplary customer service. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & cozy and close to Sea-Tac airport!”
Reviews.Author: PDLGM
Reviews.Content: To avoid the long drive from another city in Washington, and to avoid any possible traffic delays, my husband and I stayed here to catch a flight out in the early morning. Service was great and the restaurant had excellent quality food! The room was standard - too small if you ask me - but it was nice and cozy enough for a 1-night stay. I also forgot a peice of jewlery in the restroom and the staff was quick to send it to me. Thank you, Marriott!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, staff needs some education on local area. $13/day wifi!!”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTraveler78
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. It has a very unique indoor pool. The rooms are very nice, modern and well-equipped. The in-room wifi is a complete ripoff and is unacceptable when paying these kinds of rates. Of course then most people went to the business center and one of the computers was broken so you always had to wait. Or you could sit in the lobby with your computer for free wifi. Annoying. Also the parking situation where you have to use your key to get out is annoying. But I could understand that they are near the airport and people probably try to take advantage. Otherwise it is a lovely hotel that is very clean and the sleep quality was very good. The staff should get some more education on Seattle though. If you want to go in there there was a lot of cluelessness.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Seattle Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: planeengineer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times. On a number of occations, it's just for one night before an early departure the next day. Nevertheless, they always take good care of me. And the hotel is VERY convenient to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Makes air travel seem fun again”
Reviews.Author: greylaggoose
Reviews.Content: Since I would be arriving late into SeaTac from the East coast, I decided to stay one night at the airport Marriott before heading into Seattle the next morning to meet friends. I expected just a bit of convienence but instead found a wonderful welcome to Seattle in an unexpectedly luxurious setting. The hotel itself was lovely, evoking a sense of Northwest charm. The lobby was comfortable and inviting, with a bar that overlooked the garden style pool/atrium. I enjoyed a delicious jumbo shrimp cocktail with a generous glass of wine. It was a wonderful way to relax after a very long day of travel, especially knowing that my room was just steps away. The location was as convienient as can be - minutes from the airport with shuttles running at frequent intervals. (I know this for a fact since I used the shuttle several times, having forgotten something at the hotel and using the shuttle to pick it up before I flew out of town). The staff - the front desk, the shuttle drivers. the bartender, the waiters at breakfast, the store clerk - all of them were wonderful - friendly, professional and helpful. (One desk clerk seemed to be having a bit of a bad day when I returned to pick up my forgotten item, but I, too, was feeling a bit rushed and inpatient - still, it was nothing that detracted from the overall experience). Perhaps tellingly, there seemed to be quite a few flight crews staying at the hotel. In my experience, I haven't found too many airport hotels that would be worth the visit besides the convienence - the SeaTac Marriott is an exception. It's a nice hotel, airport or not! It made flying seem like fun again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ammatlanta
Reviews.Content: Basic Marriott near the airport. There is an airport shuttle to the hotel or parking (pay) at the hotel. There is breakfast for rewards members. The location is not in the best section of town; however, it is across the street from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Wonderful Lobby/bar/swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: b1ue1cz
Reviews.Content: Great for business. Near airport, highway, easy to get in and out. Great room service, meal came hot and extra sauce exactly as I requested. Lounge was nice as well. Internet had decent speeds in the evening. Only reason I did not give a perfect rating, bathroom on the 8th floor was a little small, but was ok. Great job to the hotel management. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “GIIVE THAT MANAGER A RAISE!!!”
Reviews.Author: valcarcejim
Reviews.Content: I stopped staying at this hotel a few years ago, and reluctantly agreed to stay for an overnight quick business trip. Wow what a difference. The rooms, and in fact the entire hotel, is spottless. The health center is clean, fully detailed, and really well maintained. The conceirge lounge, which years ago was a disaster, was amazing and staffed with a really wonderful, friendly and upbeat host who served amazing snacks. I really was shocked by the hotel and the fact that I did not have one complaint. Everything was PERFECT. Please give that manager a raise! All Marriotts need to send their managers to this hotel to see how a well run hotel operates. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST”
Reviews.Author: cless
Reviews.Content: Everything was fantastic, from the time the courtesy van driver picked us up at the airport until we returned to the airport. We had a flight mixup and found ourselves at the airport at 7 pm, with no room and 28 hours until our red eye flight the next evening. We were able to get reservations immediately using the Marriott central phone reservation system. The van arrived within 15 minutes and we were at the hotel 10 minutes after that. We were greeted with extreme courtesy at the hotel. The front desk clerk was especially cheerful and helpful. She provided us with a Marriott Platinum room upgrade before I even requested it. Once we got settled in the large, comfortable room, we went to the Club Lounge and were, again, pleasantly greeted. The manager asked if we'd had dinner (it was about 7:30) and when we replied we had not, she prepared us a wonderful dinner from the evening's buffet, even tho it had closed at 7 pm. She was very attentive throughout the time we spent in the Club Room. The indoor pool and hot tub were wonderful. Perfect temperature and wonderful scenery. The workout facility was top rate. The next day we had breakfast in the Club Room. Again, great food and service. We had a late lunch in the lobby bar. Superb food and service. I have travelled to thirty countries, and this is one of the best hotels I have ever visited. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zippycomehappy
Reviews.Content: I realize that staying at the airport is not ideal, but if you have to, the Marriott is great! Their customer service was superb. Rooms where beautiful and the beds were VERY comfortable. The indoor atrium beautiful and the pools is warm and fun to swim in. It's also a few blocks away from 13 Coins which has great food and open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Airport Access”
Reviews.Author: crazyteapot
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms here using prepaid option. We were flying to Hawaii and used two rooms for flight out and 2 for return flight. Their shuttle picks you up at the airport and delivers you right to the door. There is a 7-Eleven just across the street and the Lite Rail Station is about 3 blocks downhill. The shuttle driver will stop at the corner for you to get to the lite rail only if you have no suitcases as it is a busy intersection. Lite rail can be accessed right from the airport so it is very easy to use and inexpensive to get to downtown to look around, $2.50 round trip. They have an excellent website that goes into more detail on Lite Rail. The only meal we was breakfast off the menu which was very good. Nice indoor pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Use Caution if Parking Your Vehicle There”
Reviews.Author: baycityart
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. It's an older property with odd room layouts but overall it is certainly an adequate airport hotel. Front desk personnel can be rather curt but the breakfast waitress was particularly friendly. However, clean out your car if you are parking there. We did not and our vehicle was broken in with window destruction and items stolen. The parking attendants told us not to worry that they would watch it but it was moved to a remote area of the parking lot and vandalized. Don't leave your car there for a lengthly stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility for overnight stay &/or for holding a conference”
Reviews.Author: hatlad
Reviews.Content: Close to SEA/TAC, nice atrium, rooms clean and relatively quiet. Conference facility very nice and staff very easy to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Business_TravelerFFX
Reviews.Content: Marriott has been my favorite brand, but this one is not one that I will return to. Because of our Marriott Rewards status, we were upgraded to the Concierge Level. However, the Concierge Lounge is closed all day on Saturday, the day we arrived, and doesn't open on Sunday until 5:30 PM. Our room, meanwhile, was on the back of the hotel facing the air handlers and exhaust units that ran all night. This is how Marriott treats its highest reward point members? I think that we will start staying at Hilton properties instead. BTW, I was also turned off by the $13.95/day charge for Internet access. What part of "Concierge Level amenities" don't these people understand? Thanks, Marriott Seattle, for a most unforgettable Concierge room experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atrium, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: VASoxfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in late September. This is an older Marriott property, as you can tell from the low ceilings and older decor. On the plus side, it's clean, comfortable with a very nice lobby, bar/restaurant, and "tropical" atrium with pool). Service was also excellent. This is a great property if you need a hotel close to the airport. Just don't stay in the "back" of the hotel, as the garbage trucks empty the dumpsters at about 5:30 every morning.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a very nice place to stop over...”
Reviews.Author: readnsurf
Reviews.Content: I came with some caution because of a few negative comments. I would recommend this hotel to others. The service was excellent and the airport shuttle goes exactly on schedule. If you come, I would request a room with a view of the pool, which was very pretty and a nice size for relaxing... As for the food, the breakfast in Aqua Terre was delicious. I would recommend the omelette with sausage, spinach, mushrooms, and parmesan cheese which was terrific. Finally, the beds were extremely comfortable and you didn't hear one plane go by!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous treatment of a friend”
Reviews.Author: suzysji
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for a friend and called to ask that they bill my credit card. When he showed up, they wouldn't use my card and he didn't have enough money, he had to go sleep in the airport. Then the hotel USED MY CARD to bill for a no-show!!!! Seriously unbelievable. And I can't get them to refund. On to disputing the charge with my credit card company. I will not be staying at any Marriott soon, and NEVER this one!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, standard Mariott”
Reviews.Author: KingHuskey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to start a trip to Mt. Rainier as it was close to the airport. The property was pretty nice, they have a great indoor pool and a nice restaurant/lounge. The only drawback was the apartment behind the hotel, I could hear some noise from there. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel doesn't feel like an "airport" hotel at all. I wish I stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: archangeli
Reviews.Content: I was worried this hotel might be noisy since the bar & restaurant in the lobby were very busy, but my worries were unnecessary. Like most Marriott's this hotel was a haven for me to rest and relax. I had a room with a king-sized bed. The bed was wonderfully comfortable, with a mountain of pillows. Each bedside lamp has a plug outlet at it's base for charging your phone - although one of the lamp outlets wasn't working in my room. There was a LCD TV, coffee/tea maker, but no refrigerator. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, and had a real hairdryer (not one of those horrible wall-mounted things). This hotel has Bath & Body works amenity products in Orange-Ginger scent. The scent was a bit strong, but nothing I couldn't deal with, however someone will a perfume allergy might find it overpowering. The hotel charges 12.95/day for WiFi or wired internet access unless you have a voucher (for a convention, etc). There is an ethernet cable provded in the desk drawer. There are LOTS of conference rooms of various sizes. The indoor pool is gorgeous - it has an outdoor feel since it's located in the atrium of the hotel. It made me think of a lovely cruise ship/ resort. There is a complimentary airport shuttle to SEA that runs every 15-20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: B'sbirdhouse
Reviews.Content: Came for the Feis (Irish dance compitition) and stayed a couple more days to enjoy Seattle. Nice staff, nice rooms, nice pool (very nice according to my kids). Although it is out by the airport we found it fairly easy to get wherever we wanted. The new LRT line can get you downtown quickly. I hope to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Served our purposes well for a one-night stay over”
Reviews.Author: gaken
Reviews.Content: Like a number of other reviewers, my wife and I stayed at this Marriott on both the front and back ends of an Alaskan cruise. We relied on the cruise line, Lindblad, to do our booking for us and as such found a number of our fellow passengers there. Overall no serious issues. We did have a ground floor room facing the outside, which was quite a little hike from the lobby. Although that got us far away from the pool noise other reviewers have complained about, it exposed us to a whole other set of street noises -- including what sounded like Mariachi music (could never tell where it was coming from) -- at least early in the evening. Our room was fine, but I'm real easy to please as far as that goes. We had drinks and appetiziers in the bar area and breakfast in the restuaruant on both legs. The food was fine, but as is typical of hotel fair a bit overpriced. The airport shuttle was a great convenience, running about every 15-20 minutes, and we used it both times we were there. One caveat -- I gave a five rating for location, but that's because it was convenient for us coming and going to the airport. For someone looking for a more extended Seattle stay, that rating would not hold. Being a totally non-smoking hotel was another plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “A nice property with wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: OCALAFLORIDATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our way back from Vancouver having just did a 13 day Alaska cruise out of San Diego. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived that the staff were incredibly helpful, they went out of their way to make you feel welcome. The food in the restaurant was also good but not incredibly great but good for hotel food. I've stayed at some properties where the food was barely palatable. The service was a bit slow, but in the servers defense she seemed to be the only one working. The breakfast buffet was good. The room was standard Marriott room. Incredibly small bathrooms and I mean small. Internet was a charge per day which I don't understand with Marriott properties. Can stay at a courtyard and get free internet, pay more at a Marriott property and pay for the internet. The Internet should be included in the price at the higher end Marriott properties and charged for at the lower level executive hotels like Courtyard and Fairfield Inn. Overall this is an excellent choice for cruise travelers both coming into Seattle or leaving Seattle. Take advantage of the free shuttle to the airport, although we took a sedan to the airport for our very early morning flight from Seattle to Alaska. Charge of $20.00 was well worth it as we were whisked right to the Alaska Curbside check in.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mr_and_mrs_a_73
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline (for a great rate!) since we needed somewhere to stay before a flight to Hawaii. The hotel a bit dated from the outside, but as soon as you walk into the lobby you'll quickly realize that it has been updated - very modern interior. Check-in was very fast and the front desk person friendly. The room was nicely renovated and had Bath & Body Works products in the bathroom. The atrium pool area was really nicely maintained - a large pool and two hot tubs. The restaurant / lounge had fantastic food. All in all, we were really impressed with this hotel and would suggest it to anyone who is staying in the Sea-Tac area before a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - good value & family friendly”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTravelMom
Reviews.Content: We have an 18 mo old baby and my husband and I stayed there with my parents & sisters family with their 3 kids ages 11-17yrs after our cruise to Alaska. The rooms were clean and spacious but there was no minibar/refrigerator in the room so I couldn't keep food in there for my son. We were in adjoining rooms 286 & 284 facing the atrium/pool. It was noisy due to the echo of kids playing in the pool all day & night and we could hear music from a ballroom event. My parents were in room 275 facing the airport and their room was very quiet but a bit far from the lobby. The enclosed pool was awesome and our kids had a great time swimming. The room service was ridiculously slow so we drove 5 min up International Boulevard to Subway. The hotel is minutes from the airport and the free hotel shuttle runs every 15 min, they are super courteous and helped my parents who have a wheelchair with all our bags. There is a kiosk in the lobby that allows you to check in online and print your boarding pass for free, plus a display on the wall showing the current departure times for all flights. There is a Hertz rental car kiosk in the lobby and we rented a car for 2 days at a good rate. All very convenient. There is a train stop a short walk from the hotel which might take you into Downtown. Free internet access in the lobby but my computer got the signal in my room. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone with kids or without. If you want quiet, I'd recommend a non-atrium facing room.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Visit”
Reviews.Author: Dave127
Reviews.Content: I stay at Sea-Tac Marriott on 06-11-10 because of an early flight the next morning. Was picked up at the airport after dropping off my rental car. The shuttle was very prompt and I learned that it ran every 15 minutes from the hotel. At the hotel check in was very fast. My family was given a room over looking the indoor pool. Previous reviews that said it was loud if you have a room facing the pool were correct. The rooms are not large, but have stayed in ones that are smaller. If you want a quiet room request a room facing the exterior. When flying out the next morning the shuttle to airport was once again prompt and it was a short 5 minute ride. One recomendation to the hotel would be to add insulated windows to the interior rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Visited for a conference. Beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: KaceyB
Reviews.Content: Visited for a conference. Beautiful hotel. Had to do a double take-- not your typical airport hotel!! I didn't try the restaurant, but conference food was excellent. Very fresh, nicely presented. Staff was great. Not great for tourist stay (it's a haul to city center). But excellent if needing to be near the airport!!

Reviews.Title: “Aging Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: Mooneydriver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SeaTac Marriott for two nights. It's an older Marriott property, and it shows its age. Rooms are recently upgraded with the most recent Marriott furnishings, but they are rather small. Bathrooms are rather small as well (but not as small as some Marriotts). Water-saving faucets are a joke (in general, I have a dim view of hotels that claim to be earth-friendly but don't bother to recycle bottles and cans). The AC in my room was quiet and functional. Windows are not as soundproof as some other airport hotels. Fortunately, the hotel is1/2 mile east of the main runways and as such away from flight arrival-departure paths. One design flaw of the hotel is that it is centered around a covered courtyard which contains the swimming pool. Yes, there's a large swimming pool in the middle of the hotel! As a result, the atrium and surrounding areas smell like chlorine. Fortunately, my room faced the outside (parking lot) instead of the atrium and smelled fresh enough. Parking is expensive, but there's a convenient free shuttle to SeaTac. The Concierge Lounge breakfast is unappetizing, consisting of eggs, greasy sausage, some fruit, and supermarket bread. Finally, free internet access for Marriott Rewards Gold and Platinum members. Others pay $12.95/night like most Marriotts. Friendly staff. Would I stay here again? Probably, but mostly for the convenience. The Hilton nearby looks newer - worth trying the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: aneckc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a conference and was pleasantly surprised to have my room available for check in at 0700 when I arrived. The elevators were far off from the check in desk. No covered parking. The bed was comfortable and the the flat screen TV had many HD channels. The bathroom was tiny and the water saving faucet was pathetic. Took a long time for the hot water to warm up and inadequate spray. The toilet fixture sounded very cheap as well. Worst of all was the small soap more reminiscent of a Motel 6 than a Marriott Hotel. I'd rate this hotel no better than a 3* Better hotels like the Hilton and Doubletree nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: sulumat
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, quiet and bed was comfortable. Bedding was very nice and the bathroom had plenty of towels. The shower worked with great water pressure and consistent hot water with an easy to operate temp. adjustment. Big TV screen, comfy chair, good AC control and a window that opened. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I am very impressed with this 3 star hotel having stayed at the other 3 1/2 star hotels in the area. This hotel is much nicer than the others. One other thing that is very important to me-the reading light was bright enough to read quite a rarity.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Sea-Tac Hotel - Part of Package Deal - But Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gr8times4me
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Seattle Marriott Sea-Tac Hotel as part of a cruise package deal. After a long day of flying from Tennessee, we checked into our room with no problem. went downstairs to the lobby and had a delicious dinner at the Atrium Lounge & Bar. Then we went back to our room to rest a little and immediately fell into a deep sleep. When we awoke in the morning, I had to find out what company made the pillows. After removing the pillowcase and zippered covering, I discovered it was the Pacific Coast Co. When we got home from our trip, I contacted the company and ordered two pillows. Then we got packed and went down to the Aqua Terra restaurant and had their "Good Start" breakfast buffet. You got coffee or tea, juice, fresh fruit, danish & pastries, eggs done anyway you requested, sausage, bacon, hash browned potatoes and pancakes. Everything was fresh & hot and our waiter would refill our coffee and juice. The cost was $13.95 plus TX and gratuity. We were really glad we did the buffet, because our trip from the hotel to the airport to catch our bus ride from Seattle to Vancouver was long (approximately 4 hours from hotel to the cruise ship) with no stops to eat. Hotel had lovely decor, a pool (which we didn't have time to use) large, quiet, comfortable rooms and a computer room. If we ever get back to Seattle, we would definitely stay here, because it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmooring
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel, as we arrived at Sea-Tac, and again when we were departing at Sea-Tac, and we can only be positive about our whole experience. The staff was wonderful, the accomodations were great, and if you can get an atrium view, you will think you are in Florida. We had a great room service breakfast both times. The airport shuttle was convenient and dependable. We would like to take the bed home with us!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at the hilton or doubletree next time!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaJosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average at best. No big deal at all. I really wish that i had stayed at the Doubletree or Hilton instead. I saw them both and they looked much better. Room is very, Very small and extremely stuffy. Service is good. It was not noisy. Pool is nice. Food is not good. Shuttle is fine. Room was not very clean. I don't think it is up to typical Marriott standards. Wish i didn't see the lobby's of the hilton and doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL COMFY HOTEL, SERVICE LEFT ALOT TO BE DESIRED”
Reviews.Author: AmberNicole625
Reviews.Content: My BF, his brother and I were traveling to Anchorage, AK for Thanksgiving Holiday. We had a long layover (8.5) hours overnight so instead of roughing it in the airport made reservations for this hotel to just get some food and sleep. This hotel was also convenient because they had a comped shuttle to and from the airport. This hotel is absolutely stunning!! Looks like a ski lodge but its in the middle of downtown seattle!! Beautiful indoor pool and atrium and guest beds were so so comfy. Rooms were clean as could be. Only wished we could have stayed longer. ON THE OTHER HAND.... when we checked in we asked about the comlimentary lounge for Platinum Marriott Rewards members and were told it was closed "for the holiday"....4 days before the "holiday" Kind of strange right? So then when we got to the room we were all trying to decide if we just wanted to order room service or go down to the restaurant. Boys decided restaurant would be good. Called the front desk to ask what time the restaurant closed, they said 10 pm. Well being that it was 8:40pm we made our way down to the restaurant only to find out that it was closed "for the holiday" ...again 4 days before the holiday. After explaining that we had just called and they told us it was open until 10 they recommend that we sit in the bar (with a 14 yr old). Bar told us go to the restaurant because 14 yr olds are not permitted in bar(DUH). FINALLY, they agreed to seat us and after all that BS we had a VERY good steak dinner. One of the BEST I had had in a while. All in all beautiful hotel, great food, crappy staff. Seemed like laziness if you ask me... closing for the holiday 4 days before the date. Disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nittany&Fargo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sea-Tac Marriott for one evening on a business trip. It is located directly across the street from the airport, so it is a great location if you arrive on a late flight, or have to leave on an early flight. I arrived on a late flight. I slept in a bit the next morning, and never heard any plane noise, so the hotel is well sound proofed. The parking is restricted, but there is plenty available and it is free if you self-park. The lobby is unique and rustic, with plenty of overstuffed couches and fireplaces. My check-in went smoothly and I had a room on the 9th floor. (Note - another reviewer said there were only five floors; this is true in parts of the hotel, but there is an annex with 9 floors that is separate from the main courtyard area.) I ordered room service for dinner (the crab sandwich and a salad). The food was delivered promptly and was quite tasty. The room itself was small, as many airport hotels are since space is usually at a premium. The bathroom was particularly tiny. However, the bed was quite comfortable, and there was plenty of work space. There are also robes in the closet. The workout room was spectacular - one of the nicest anywhere. There were numerous ellipticals, treadmills, and bikes, all with personal TVs and headphones provided. There were also several weight machines. Fresh fruit was provided along with a refrigerator that offered cool towels. There were plenty of sanitizing wipes, cups, water, everything for an enjoyable workout. The pool area is quite lovely and peaceful. There are plenty of tables and chairs scattered around. Of course, I had to take photos of the huge totem pole. Very cute! The small gift shop has prepared items for a quick breakfast. I grabbed a fruit cup and a bagel and cream cheese and it was quite reasonable and fresh. Upon checkout, I was easily able to arrange to keep my car at the hotel for a few hours past checkout while my colleague drove us to a meeting. The front desk was very accommodating. By the way, I saw no bugs or black widow spiders. In fact, I thought the hotel and my room were spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Black Widow Spider Bite - DO NOT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Guest33
Reviews.Content: I received a serious, poisonous spider bite, most likely from a black widow, as it had neurotoxic effects. When I wrote the hotel about it, they denied it could have happened there. Yet, I was sleeping on a roll-away bed in the room that may have been stored somewhere where the spider could have hidden. Also, the housekeeping staff left the window open every day, and there are no screens on the window. The hotel did not take my complaint seriously at all. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a convention or group meetings”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFlash
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel staff great! They went out of their way to make the convention work. It's not easy to make 150 men and women happy with convention meals, rooms and various events. The food was wonderful and we come to the restaurant of lunch often. Chef is really good. The parking rates are a little hard for day visitors/seniors but that's the only complaint. They were fabulous and we would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MarkG45
Reviews.Content: It is best to stay out by Sea-Tac airport...less than 10 minutes from downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Only an average Hotelwith poor shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: HEPF
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed, especially after so many great reviews on this Hotel. Let me highlight the downsides: It’s not the closest hotel to the airport. I had to be at the airport at 3 am, but they run the shuttle service only from 4 am to 12 am, so I had to order a cab to get there! Something not expected by an airport hotel. And the problem is that I found out about this just when I was expecting to leave the hotel, so I had to wait close to 15 minutes for the cab to come. There is only one elevator servicing the 3 floors, and there are no stairs close by, so if the elevator is stuck on a floor, you just have to go up/down through the emergency stairs. The room was simply average, being the bathroom a bit old fashioned and not well maintained. For the price they charge, there are simply better and cheaper options around.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: lookingglass101
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel for business. It was clean and quite. Not a good location for fun (next to airport) but good for traveling. They will pick you up at the airport if you call. They also have self park (free in and out with key) and valet. Bar was decent (common business travelers). Does have a nice pool, small fitness center and a business center with free printing. Nothing to0 special but a good deal for business travelors.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott wins the "bed wars", best hotel night's sleep..”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times when pressed for time with a late arrival or early flight out, and everytime I am reminded how good the Marriott bed can be. The Marriott bed beats the Westin heavenly bed hands down. This is a good night's sleep. I appreciate this property for its recent renovation, the comfort and quiet of its rooms, the 24 hr fitness center, and the ability to get up at 6 and swim laps in the albeit irregularly shaped pool. The airport shuttle service is very frequent, courteous, and works well (I dump my rental car back at the airport the night before an early flight, stay here, and end up saving money). My only complaint is particular to the hotel industry, not this property; the more you pay, the more you pay. Why can't internet access be free in "full service" hotels when it comes free at lesser cost, select service properties (Courtyard for instance). This property made me a Marriott fan, largely for its room comfort.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right, it is a little tired ...”
Reviews.Author: calvino
Reviews.Content: I had no bad experiences, and both the bed (very comfy!) and the staff (very nice!) were excellent. Good airport bus service, too. Strangely small room, but I don't really care about that. I booked the hotel based on the pictures I saw on the website and on expedia -- kind of cool looking indoor atrium, like a good Hyatt. The pictures do not lie, but on the other hand a closer resolution reveals that all the common areas in the hotel are pretty tired. The restaurant was definitely not worth a visit, although I'll put in a plug for the Eggs Benedict at the buffet (!). Not the handmade omelets, which are basically scrambled eggs with stuff in them. If you want a good meal, get one the other side of security at the airport (Vino Volo or Anthony's), or else walk a block to the Hilton and go to Spenser's. At the time I booked I could have got either the Hilton or the Doubletree for the same amount. Judging what I've read on the site, I should have gone for the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: ALERTDIVER
Reviews.Content: We came through Seattle on our way to Maui and stayed at the Fairfield Inn. It was is always clean, close to the airport, and it was free as we had cashed in reward points. The rooms were comfortable and nicely appointed with a small refrigerator, microwave oven, and other small items. The breakfast spread that they serve every morning in the dining room can't be beat. It comes with your nightly stay and was very good. We were given 4 bottled waters and we checked out. All I ask is a clean, safe, comfortable place to rest my head, and the Fairfield Inn always comes through

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad full service Marriott”
Reviews.Author: accountant_guy
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a full service Marriott that hasn't charged for Internet, and maybe only a few suburban ones in the midwest that didn't charge for parking. I have been a Marriott rewards platinum, gold, or silver member for many years depending on how much I traveled for business in a particular year. To complain about this, is like to complain about McDonald's charging for fries and a coke with a burger. If you don't like it, stay in a non-business class hotel. The reason they charge is because these are all reimbursable expenses for most business travelers. The reason Fairfield doesn't charge is because they are an economy hotel geared more toward thrifty travelers. So I have no complaints about the charges for extras because I expected it. I got this room on a Thursday and Friday for 129 which was a good value in my opinion. This is especially true considering I went to the flight museum and to Alki beach one of those days. The location is great if you are not touring the downtown area. The room was totally clean and updated. The outside of the building looks a bit old, but the entire interior has been redone in the past few years. it is actually quite hip. My only complaint is that I swiped a card at check-in and changed payment method upon check out. My initial card got charged, however this was only a minor convenience. This was certainly not the best full service I have ever stayed in, but it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: terryjgardner
Reviews.Content: The Marriott at SEATAC is a perfectly acceptable, completely average Marriott property. Good, expensive restaurants, accurate, pleasant staff, accommodations acceptable without being outstanding in any way. Marriott offers internet connections at an outrageous price - similar to its competition. All hotels should get with the program of complimentary internet connections.

Reviews.Title: “Way more than expected”
Reviews.Author: Thunderfist
Reviews.Content: We stopped in here because the downtown Marriott's where already full for the weekend. But we were pleasantly surprised. Super comfortable beds, and indoor swimming pool that's amazing. Great food at the restaurants--although pricey. I loved this hotel and would absolutely stay here again. More more than expected for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only there for one night, but a great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbfgator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way home from Alaska so that we could easily get to the airport the next morning. It's less than 5 minutes away from Sea-Tac and transportation to and from is quick and easy.
